decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and quickly control the game through cards like Stock Up and Force of Will. It includes a variety of powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to maintain card advantage and have answers to threats. The inclusion of cards like Show and Tell and Flash allows for explosive plays to quickly put the opponent on the back foot. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a dominant board presence.

This deck focuses on assembling a strong control strategy through artifact manipulation and disruptive spells. By combining cards like Paradox Engine, Time Vault, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's options and seize control of the game. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen allows for explosive plays and fast mana acceleration, while cards like Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent through versatile artifact-based control strategies.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence and tempo advantage. By utilizing a combination of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Mana Denial with Wasteland, alongside powerful threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, the deck aims to pressure and out-value the opponent in the mid to late game. Additionally, synergies with Deathrite Shaman, Collector Ouphe, and Psychic Frog provide additional disruption and card advantage to help secure victory.

The deck focuses on using powerful control spells and disruptive creatures to outmaneuver opponents in order to gain card advantage and control the game tempo. By utilizing counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to protect its key threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion, allowing for a flexible and resilient control strategy that can adapt to various matchups in the Vintage format.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly with artifact mana and using powerful spells like Time Walk and Ancestral Recall to gain card advantage. The key combo involves using Tinker to fetch Time Vault and Voltaic Key to take infinite turns. The deck also utilizes cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Coveted Jewel to generate additional mana and card advantage. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces to overwhelm opponents with powerful spells and artifacts.

This deck relies on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive artifact creatures and disrupting the opponent's resources with mana denial effects like Wasteland and Sphere of Resistance. The deck also utilizes Mishra's Workshop to power out big threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem, while also having access to powerful utility cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive plays, solidifying board control and ultimately winning through a combination of combat damage and resource denial.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the game by playing hatebears that hinder their ability to cast spells efficiently and attack with aggressive creatures to quickly close out the game. The deck utilizes disruptive creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex, combined with powerful artifacts like Trinisphere and the Moxen to quickly establish board presence and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. The deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's mana base to secure victory in a fast-paced matchup.

The key concept of this Aggro - MUD deck is to utilize artifact mana acceleration and powerful artifacts such as Grim Monolith, The One Ring, and Sensei's Divining Top to quickly ramp up and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature threats like Scrawling Crawler and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to control the opponent's spells. Additionally, the deck can generate additional advantage through card draw with Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and card selection with Mystic Forge. The deck aims to leverage its powerful artifacts and aggressive creatures to win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana and card advantage to enable explosive combo plays utilizing Paradoxical Outcome. By utilizing powerful artifact cards and efficient spells, the deck aims to draw through the deck quickly, generate infinite mana with cards like Tolarian Academy and Underworld Breach, and eventually win the game with a Brain Freeze or Flame of Anor to mill the opponent's deck. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional resiliency and value to the deck.

The deck focuses on assembling a combination of cards that generate a large amount of mana quickly, protect the combo pieces, and then win the game in a single turn using the Storm mechanic. By efficiently casting spells and chaining them together, the deck aims to build up a high storm count to finish off the opponent with a powerful spell like Tendrils of Agony. The deck includes various tutors and fast mana sources to help achieve this goal as quickly and consistently as possible.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive artifacts. By using cards like Mishra's Workshop, Wasteland, and Sphere of Resistance, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Stonecoil Serpent to apply pressure. Key cards like Crucible of Worlds and Nettlecyst provide resilience and additional value, making it difficult for the opponent to find an answer. The deck's goal is to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements and card advantage to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By leveraging cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Spell Pierce, as well as counterspells like Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the game and slow down the opponent's progress. Additionally, card draw spells like Ancestral Recall, Treasure Cruise, and Dig Through Time provide the player with consistent access to powerful cards. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card recursion and value generation.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources while deploying powerful threats, such as Oko, Thief of Crowns and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, to control the game. The main strategy revolves around using disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also using counter magic like Force of Will to protect our own threats. The deck utilizes a combination of efficient card draw spells and removal to maintain card advantage and control the board, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a mix of disruption and pressure.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful artifact mana acceleration to quickly cast Coveted Jewel, which can generate immense card advantage and mana advantage. By using cards like Tinker to put Coveted Jewel into play early, the deck can overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and disruptive tempo plays. The inclusion of Force of Will and Sink into Stupor provide protection and disruption to control the game while utilizing powerful win conditions like The One Ring and Sicarian Infiltrator to finish the opponent off. The deck aims to dictate the pace of the game and win through powerful combo plays.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and control over the game. Utilizing powerful cards such as Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Wasteland, the deck aims to control the board state and counter threats. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion. By efficiently using spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, the deck can outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through careful planning and precise decision-making.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly while drawing additional cards to find key combo pieces. It utilizes Paradoxical Outcome to bounce a large number of artifacts back to hand, generating more mana and drawing more cards in the process. The goal is to ultimately create a loop with Underworld Breach and Brain Freeze to mill the opponent's deck and win the game. By utilizing powerful mana acceleration and card draw, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent.
